abstracts.cdata!:
This project paper concerns to introduce
            changes in the project documents for the Jamaica Second
            HIV/AIDS Control and Prevention Project. The changes are all
            related to the results framework: (a) replacing four project
            development objective (PDO) indicators with three indicators
            that are more appropriate for measuring the project's
            achievements; and (b) revising component output and results
            indicators by adding four new indicators, removing six
            indicators, and refining indicators and targets based on
            data availability and the appropriateness of the indicators
            in tracking project progress. The revised PDO indicators are
            better linked to the priority areas of the project:
            promoting condom use among the youth, prevention of
            mother-to-child transmission (PMTCT), and reducing stigma
            and discrimination. The changes will not affect the original
            PDOs or the project design. The revised indicators will
            allow for more accurate measurement of the project's
            progress and impact.
